title.narrative: CAPACITIES OF SWF AND CP SYSTEM

description.narrative: Social welfare and child protection system has an enhanced capacity for and oversight of planning, provision and coordination of quality social and child protection interventions and services, in a culturally sensitive way, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls, boys and caregivers, especially those affected by poverty, adversity and exclusion progressively utilise quality, equitable, mutually reinforcing systems of health, social and child protection, including in situation of humanitarian crisis by 2021.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Social welfare and child protection system has an enhanced capacity for and oversight of planning, provision and coordination of quality social and child protection interventions and services, in a culturally sensitive way

description.narrative: UNICEF is assisting the Government to increase capacities of social welfare and child protection professionals to better coordinate, implement and monitor social and child protection standards, policies and services. Strengthening the social service workforce remains a priority as highlighted in several analyses conducted by UNICEF. To support the Government in its response to the increasing number of refugee and migrants arriving in the country, UNICEF undertook a rapid needs assessment and trained front-line workers in meeting the needs of refugee and migrant children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/12/2019
